question: A 35-year-old man with a history of intravenous (IV) drug abuse has generalized lymphadenopathy. Which of the following tests would help in finding the cause of his lymphadenopathy?

A 65-year-old male presents with a 2-month history of fever and weight loss. On examination, the spleen is palpable 6 cm below the left costal margin. Complete blood count (CBC) reveals leukocytes=125x10⁹/L, hemoglobin=7.0 gm/dL and platelets= 510X10³/µL . He is diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia. Which of the following defects is present in chronic myeloid leukemia?
Putrefaction is said to be colliquative when there is which of the following?

answers.option: Colour change at right iliac fossa

question: The process of decomposition in the air is twice as rapid as in water and eight times as rapid as in the soil. What is the name of this process?
Which of the following is not correct about non-Hodgkin lymphoma?

answers.option: t(14:18) in follicular lymphoma results in dysregulated BCL2 expression
Burkitt lymphoma is most aggressive and incurable
Males have a slightly higher risk
Epstein-Barr virus is associated with post-transplant non-Hodgkin lymphoma

question: A 45-year-old male who is bed-bound from paraplegia develops sudden shortness of breath. On examination, his right calf is found to be swollen and tender, a provisional diagnosis of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism is made. What will be the single most sought diagnostic test?
Why is low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) preferred over unfractionated heparin (UFH)?

answers.option: LMWH can be given in all conditions

question: Which of the following is the first immediate sign after death?
A guy who shoots himself tends to get instantaneous rigor instead of rigor mortis. Which one of the following statements most likely signifies the difference between the two?

answers.option: Instantaneous rigor affects all the muscles
Instantaneous rigor indicates time of death instead of mode of death
Muscle contraction is less marked in instantaneous rigor mortis
Primary relaxation is absent in instantaneous rigor mortis
Instantaneous rigor mortis is not immediate after the death

question: A dead body is found by a group of people near the station. It is concluded that 6 to 10 hours have passed since the time of death. Which one of the following is most likely to be developed by this time in the body?
Which of the following is the most commonly encountered pattern of fingerprints?

A 45-year-old male presents with a 2-month history of fever and weight loss. On examination, massive splenomegaly is observed. Complete blood count (CBC) reveals leukocyte count=165x10⁹/L, hemoglobin= 9.0 gm/dL and platelets=510 X10³/µL . He is diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia. Which of the following molecular defects is present in chronic myeloid leukemia?
For the purpose of determining age and sex from the skeleton of an unknown dead body, maximum information can be obtained by examining which of the following?

A fresh victim of a road traffic accident is brought to the emergency department but lost his life on the way to the hospital. To confirm his death, the body is examined for all immediate signs of death. Which of the following is an immediate sign of death?

The dead body of a young female is recovered from her house hanging from a fan. On examination it is seen that post mortem lividity in lower limbs is fully developed and fixed. If, in the dead body, the post mortem lividity does not blanch on applying pressure, what will be the probable time elapsed since her death?
Which of the following statements describe the working of alteplase?

A 10-year-old child with a known case of thalassemia major requires red cell transfusion every month, since the age of one year. For the last 5 to 6 months, he develops urticarial rashes during transfusion. What will be an appropriate step for management?

answers.option: Prior to transfusion, give him antihistamine and antipyretic drugs
Prior to transfusion, give him one shot of steroid

question: Which of the following is the surest sign to determine that hanging was ante-mortem, rather than post-mortem?
A boy is convicted of a criminal offense and the judge of the juvenile court orders to send him to a reformatory school. This is because his age is less than which of the following?
Different blood products are transfused in different clinical conditions. Which product is required if a patient is bleeding actively and has deficiencies of multiple coagulation factors?
Which of the following antibodies are present in Bernard-Soulier syndrome?
A cord blood sample of an Rh-ve mother was sent for laboratory testing during labor. Which of the following would indicate the need for blood exchange transfusion?

answers.option: Indirect coombs test is weakly negative

question: The postmortem sign of 'cattle trucking' is seen in which organ?
Which of the following is the result of vitamin B12 deficiency?

A 29-year-old female comes for a routine checkup as part of a pre-employment requirement. Her complete blood count reveals Hb= 10 gm/dL with microcytic hypochromic red cell indices. Assuming that she is a carrier of the beta-thalassemia trait, what will be the most likely findings on her hemoglobin electrophoresis to confirm her carrier status?

answers.option: Normal HbA and A2, but slightly increased HbF
Normal HbA and increased Hb A2 (3-5%)
Normal HbA and increased Hb A2 (4-8%)
Decreased HbA,and raised HbA2 and HbF
Normal HbA and A2, but markedly increased HbF (>90%)

question: A detective is searching for evidence at a crime scene when he encounters fingerprints on the doorknob. He takes the impressions for examination. Inspection reveals that the pattern resembles hairpin heads that are elongated in the left direction. What is the most likely fingerprint pattern in this case?

A young boy is arrested due to a criminal charge. The court orders a detailed forensic examination to determine his age. Pelvic X-ray findings show that the ischium and pubis are not yet fused. What is the approximate age of the boy?

A 21-year-old female presents with petechiae on her skin and episodes of epistaxis for the last two months. On examination, there is no hepatosplenomegaly or lymphadenopathy. Which of the following is the most sensitive earliest test for making a diagnosis?

The age of a young boy needs to be determined. Dental X-ray reveals mixed dentition and examination of the oral cavity reveals that the first molars have erupted. What is the approximate age of this boy?

The approximate age of a girl needs to be determined as ordered by the court. After getting a series of X-rays done, it is revealed that she has only 3 carpal bones ossified. What is the likely age of the girl?

A 19-year-old girl presents to the office with non-tender, rubbery, enlarged cervical lymph nodes. She also has a low-grade fever and her complete blood count is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the composition of adult hemoglobin?
Where will hypostasis be seen in a body drowned in running water?
Which of these factors can lead to poor tissue oxygenation?
Which of these terms best explain the pancytopenia observed in aplastic anemia?

An 11-year-old girl presents with a petechial rash all over her body. Her bleeding time and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) are prolonged but the prothrombin time (PT) is normal. Her sister also suffers from a similar condition. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following chromosomes contain the gene for the beta-globin chain of hemoglobin?
Which of the following genotypes correctly correspond to the silent carrier state of alpha thalassemia?
Which type of hemolysis characterizes paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH)?
A 16-year-old boy, known case of hemophilia, injures himself while playing football and develops hemarthrosis in his right knee. What is the best treatment option?
Which of these indices is best for determining the race of a person?
What do flow cytometry results show in paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria?

answers.option: Single type of cell population showing CD55-, CD59-
Single type of cell population showing CD55+, CD59-
Single type of cell population showing CD55+, CD59+
Single type of cell population showing CD55-, CD59+
Two types of cell populations: one CD55-, CD59- and second CD55+, CD59+

question: A dead body is brought to the mortuary for post mortem examination. The post-mortem rigidity is present throughout the body from head to toe. What is the estimated time of death?
Which of these is a common manifestation of antiphospholipid syndrome?

A 17-year-old boy presents to the office with complaints of weakness and shortness of breath. On examination, he appears to have jaundice and also has splenomegaly. He was treated for malaria one week ago. Which test can be done to determine the cause of anemia?
What is the inheritance pattern of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency?
What is the shape of entry wounds formed as a result of stabbing?
A 12-year-old girl is sent for age determination. On which part of the body will the X-ray be performed?
Which of these is a direct thrombin inhibitor?
Which of the following drugs binds to ADP receptors on platelets and thus inhibits platelet aggregation?
A 4-year-old boy has a form of microcytic, hypochromic anemia. His skull X-ray shows a crew-cut appearance. Which form of thalassemia is most likely in this patient?
A dead body is brought in for post mortem examination and according to an eye witness, the death occurred 6-8 hours ago. Which of these signs will confirm the witness's account?

answers.option: Fully developed but not fixed lividity
Greenish discoloration of the right flank
Rigor mortis in the entire body

question: Which of these terms best describes the characteristics/features of disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC)?
During the examination of a dead body, greenish discoloration in the right iliac fossa is seen. The abdomen is distended and the limbs are rigid. What term best describes the condition?
Which of these methods of tattoo removal does not leave a scar?

A 2-year-old boy presents with frontal and parietal bossing and a history of severe pallor for 1 month. His mother and father are first cousins. He has another sibling who has had blood transfusions. Hemoglobin electrophoresis shows an HbA1 of 15 percent and HbF of 85 percent. What is the most likely diagnosis?

Which of these terms best describes thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura?

answers.option: Microangiopathic hemolytic anemia (MAHA) plus neurologic symptoms and thrombocytopenia

question: What is the correct definition of anemia?

answers.option: Decreased total red blood cell mass
Decreased circulating red blood cell mass

question: What is the mode of action of warfarin?

answers.option: Inhibition of vitamin K epoxide reductase

question: Which medication can commonly lead to a hypercoagulable state?
Which type of anemia is associated with Plummer-Vinson syndrome?

A 24-year-old male presents to the office with an enlarging lump on his neck. Lymph node biopsy reveals lymphocytic infiltration in the germinal center along with tingible body macrophages in a 'starry sky' appearance. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old child presents with low-grade fever and a mass on the right side of the neck which has been enlarging for the past two weeks. The mass is an enlarged lymph node in the anterior cervical chain. It is firm, non-tender, and rubbery. Which test needs to be ordered to confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: Bone marrow aspiration and trephine biopsy

question: The dead body of a young female is recovered from her house hanging from a fan. On examination, it is seen that post mortem lividity in lower limbs has fully developed and blanches on applying pressure. What will be the probable time elapsed since the death?
Which stage of erythropoiesis has a condensed nucleus with 34% hemoglobin and no endoplasmic reticulum?

What is the maximum amount of hemoglobin that can be concentrated in the red blood cell fluid?
What is the mean age of occurrence of myelodysplastic syndrome?
A decapitated dead body of a male is brought for autopsy. What will be the most important part of an autopsy in this case for further identification?

answers.option: Taking bone marrow for DNA fingerprinting
Preservation of 1st vertebra of the body distal to the cut

question: Which transfusion product of blood carries the highest risk of bacterial contamination?
Which of the following white blood cells produce the major basic protein?

The clinical diagnosis by the physician is multiple myeloma. Assuming that the clinical diagnosis is correct, what will be the most characteristic finding on the peripheral film of his peripheral smear?

Which of the following chromosomal abnormalities is absent in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL)?

The age of a male needs to be determined. Dental X-ray reveals mixed dentition and an examination of the oral cavity reveals that his wisdom tooth has erupted. What is the approximate age of this person?

A child has had a fever for 15 days. He has been taking antipyretics and antibiotics. His complete blood count report shows leukopenia and absolute neutropenia. What would be the cause of neutropenia?

Which one of the following is not one of the reasons why oral iron gluconate is not preferred?
A 32-year-old woman has given birth to a stillborn hydropic baby with hepatosplenomegaly. What will be seen in her hemoglobin electrophoresis?

answers.option: Interacting with arginine glycine aspartic acid sequence of fibrinogen
Inhibiting the activation of glycoprotein (GP) receptor llb/llla receptors
Irreversibly inhibiting binding of adenosine diphosphate (ADP) to its receptors on platelets
Blocking the binding of fibrinogen to von Willebrand factor
Increasing cAMP by inhibiting nucleotide phosphodiesterase

question: A person undergoes ileal resection. After some days he develops weakness, shortness of breath, and anemia. Which anemia can it possibly be?

A child is brought to the clinic by his parents with a complaint of fatigue. His parents further inform about their family history of blood disorder. His laboratory results show hemoglobin 9.6 mg/dL, reticulocytes 7%, and mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 87 fl. His blood smear shows the presence of spherocytes. What is the possible diagnosis?

answers.option: It is the only antiplatelet agent that irreversibly inhibits platelet function
High dose aspirin works best when used prophylactically
Low dose aspirin works best when used prophylactically

question: A primigravida presents to the antenatal clinic at 10 weeks gestation for her first visit. Her blood group is B- and she has no history of abortions or miscarriages. What is the initial test that will be done?

A 5-year-old boy comes to the outpatient department complaining of a painful and swollen knee. On examination, bleeding is seen within the knee joint but with no signs of physical trauma. His mother gives a family history of a maternal uncle who recently died of a bleeding disorder. Investigations show isolated increased APTT. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A girl is brought to the outpatient department with complaints of gum bleeding, and epistaxis. Her complete blood count (CBC) shows a normal platelet count and prolonged bleeding time. There is a family history of a younger sister with easy bruising. What is the diagnosis?
